comments.author: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.text:
Created attachment 538464
Patch v1

We don't support 10.4 anymore so you should probably not worry about that and save some cycles.
comments.creator: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.raw_text: We don't support 10.4 anymore so you should probably not worry about that and save some cycles.

Looks like this works in principle, but this patch on its own changes the vertical position of some buttons. For example the regular-sized buttons on the General preferences pane are two pixels higher.
It may well be that there's a bug in the current flipping code and that we're passing in wrong margins; but whatever causes the difference, it needs to be fixed before we can land this patch.
comments.creator: mstange.moz@gmail.com
comments.author: mstange.moz@gmail.com
comments.text:
Comment on attachment 538464
Patch v1

Looks like this works in principle, but this patch on its own changes the vertical position of some buttons. For example the regular-sized buttons on the General preferences pane are two pixels higher.
It may well be that there's a bug in the current flipping code and that we're passing in wrong margins; but whatever causes the difference, it needs to be fixed before we can land this patch.

comments.raw_text: The code used to render the button seems old and hacky: the button doesn't take the entire frame and |pushButtonSettings| doesn't even seems up to date. Interface Builder gives me different values for the height. Though, changing them makes it worse :(
comments.creator: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.author: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.text: The code used to render the button seems old and hacky: the button doesn't take the entire frame and |pushButtonSettings| doesn't even seems up to date. Interface Builder gives me different values for the height. Though, changing them makes it worse :(

comments.text:
(In reply to opi123 from comment #6)
> MacOs 10.4 is no longer supported.

Yes. This bug is dealing with removal of code that we no longer need.
